title: 2005 FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship
text:
The 2005 FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship was the eighth edition of the <a href="FIBA%20Europe%20Under-20%20Championship">FIBA Europe Under-20 Championship</a>. The city of <a href="Chekhov%2C%20Moscow%20Oblast">Chekhov</a>, in <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, hosted the tournament. <a href="Russia%20national%20basketball%20team">Russia</a> won their first title.
<a href="Ukraine%20national%20basketball%20team">Ukraine</a> and the <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20basketball%20team">Czech Republic</a> were relegated to Division B.
Format change.
For the first time, the format of the competition was changed. Four more teams entered the competition, and another round was played. The two last teams were relegated to Division B.
Preliminary round.
The sixteen teams were allocated in four groups of four teams each.
Quarter-Final round.
The eight teams were allocated in two groups of four teams each.
Classification round.
The eight teams were allocated in two groups of four teams each.
Knockout stage.
13th–16th playoffs.
Ukraine and the Czech Republic were relegated to Division B.
